predipreda 0.0.0.9000
  • Get started
  • Reference

    opitmized_RF_function

    optimized_RF_function.Rd

    opitmized_RF_function

    optimized_RF_function(
  data,
  species,
  response_data,
  trait_data,
  phylo_data = NULL,
  classification,
  weight = NULL,
  mtry_frac = NULL,
  min.node.size = NULL,
  sample.fraction = NULL,
  ntrees = NULL,
  PEMs = NULL,
  cores = 1
)

    Arguments

    data

    A species_traits dataframe containing species traits and eigen values if the user use phylogenetic data

    species

    The name of the column corresponding to the species names in the @param data

    response_data

    The name of the column corresponding to the response in the @param data

    trait_data

    A dataframe containing only species trait data

    phylo_data

    By default, phylo_data = NULL, which return an expand grid without PEMs

    classification

    Can be eiter TRUE or FALSE. If TRUE, you want to perform a classification analyses, if FALSE, you want to perform a regression analyses

    weight

    A list containing vector as the same legnth of row in the data

    mtry_frac

    By default, NULL, return a list of default values of mtry. Else, you define your own range of mtry value you want to optimize in a vector

    min.node.size

    By default, NULL, return a list of default values of minimum node size. Else, you define your own range of minimum node size value you want to optimize in a vector

    sample.fraction

    By default, NULL, return a list of default values of fraction of observations to sample. Else, you define your own range of observations to sample value you want to optimize in a vector

    ntrees

    By default, NULL, return a list of default values of number of trees. Else, you define your own range of number of trees you want to optimize in a vector

    PEMs

    ggg

    cores

    Define the number of cores you want to use. By default, the number of cores is set to 1. For Windows user, keep number of cores to 1, or switch to linux/Mac OS.

    Value

    Return a dataframe

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
library(predipreda)
data(dataset)
species <- colnames(dataset$Species_ID)
response_data <- colnames(dataset$Response)
trait_data <- dataset[,c(2:5)]
results <- optimized_RF_function(dataset,species,response_data,trait_data,phylo_data = TRUE, classification == FALSE)
}
